For the following questions, read the [ASA Statement on P-values](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/00031305.2016.1154108?needAccess=true) (link: [https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/00031305.2016.1154108?needAccess=true](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/00031305.2016.1154108?needAccess=true)) and [Moving to a World Beyond "p <.05"](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/00031305.2019.1583913?needAccess=true) (link: [https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/00031305.2019.1583913?needAccess=true](https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.1080/00031305.2019.1583913?needAccess=true))

NOTE: copying and pasting responses will not result in full credit.

#### 1. (2 points) 

In your own words, please define a p-value.

#### 2. (3 points) 

In your own words, summarize the 6 principles of p-values.

#### 3. (3 points)

Summarize why the authors state _Don’t Say “Statistically Significant”_

#### 4. (4 points)

In your own words, summarize the four components of ATOM.

#### 5. (4 points)

How has reading these two articles influenced your statistical practice moving forward?
